meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or slovenly in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The schlumps sat on the couch all day watching TV.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like a schlumps when she didn't bother to change out of her pajamas.
meanings.sent3: The schlumps at the party didn't even bother to greet anyone.
meanings.sent4: The office was full of schlumps, dragging their feet to the coffee machine.
meanings.sent5: The schlumps in the waiting room made the whole place feel dreary.

meanings.definition: To move or walk in a lazy or slouching manner.
meanings.sent1: He schlumps around the house when he's feeling tired.
meanings.sent2: The students schlumped into the classroom after lunch, looking sleepy.
meanings.sent3: The cat schlumps lazily across the sunlit floor, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent4: The old car schlumps along the bumpy road, struggling to keep up.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker schlumps up the steep hill, taking slow steps.
